net.adamcin.oakpal.core.checks

Class Rule

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.adamcin.oakpal.core.checks.Rule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JavaxJson.ObjectConvertible, OrgJson.ObjectConvertible

    public final class Rule
extends Object
implements OrgJson.ObjectConvertible, JavaxJson.ObjectConvertible
    Standard Rule tuple capturing a rule type (include/exclude or allow/deny) and a regex pattern.

    config options:

    type
    The Rule.RuleType of the rule: include or exclude (or allow or deny). The meaning of this value is usually dependent on context.
    pattern
    A regular expression pattern matched against the full context value (start [^] and end [$] are assumed).

      • isInclude

        public boolean isInclude()
        Readability alias for isAllow() when the rule is used in the more abstract context of scope definition.
        Returns:
        true if the matched value should be included.

      • isExclude

        public boolean isExclude()
        Readability alias for isDeny() when the rule is used in the more abstract context of scope definition.
        Returns:
        true if the matched value should be excluded.

      • isAllow

        public boolean isAllow()
        Readability alias for isInclude() when the rule is used in the more abstract context of scope definition.
        Returns:
        true if the matched value should be allowed.

      • isDeny

        public boolean isDeny()
        Readability alias for isExclude() when the rule is used in the more literal context of acceptable vs unacceptable values.
        Returns:
        true if the matched value should be denied.

      • matches

        public boolean matches(String value)
        Conventional usage of the rule's Pattern to match the entirety of the provided string value. The nature of the value is not considered.
        Parameters:
        value - a string value
        Returns:
        true if the pattern matches

      • fromJSON

        @Deprecated
public static List<Rule> fromJSON(org.json.JSONArray rulesArray)
        Deprecated. 1.2.0 use fromJsonArray(JsonArray) instead
        Conveniently creates a list of Rules from the conventional use case of a JSON array containing a list of rule JSON objects to be evaluated in sequence.
        Parameters:
        rulesArray - a JSON array where calling fromJSON(JSONObject) on each element will construct a valid Rule
        Returns:
        a list of rules to be evaluated in sequence.

      • fuzzyDefaultAllow

        public static Rule fuzzyDefaultAllow(List<Rule> rules)
        Return DEFAULT_ALLOW, unless first element in rules list is an explicit allow, in which case return DEFAULT_DENY.
        Parameters:
        rules - rules list
        Returns:
        usually DEFAULT_ALLOW, but sometimes DEFAULT_DENY

      • fuzzyDefaultDeny

        public static Rule fuzzyDefaultDeny(List<Rule> rules)
        Return DEFAULT_DENY, unless first element in rules list is an explicit deny, in which case return DEFAULT_ALLOW.
        Parameters:
        rules - rules list
        Returns:
        usually DEFAULT_EXCLUDE, but sometimes DEFAULT_INCLUDE

      • fuzzyDefaultInclude

        public static Rule fuzzyDefaultInclude(List<Rule> rules)
        Return DEFAULT_INCLUDE, unless first element in rules list is an explicit include, in which case return DEFAULT_EXCLUDE.
        Parameters:
        rules - rules list
        Returns:
        usually DEFAULT_INCLUDE, but sometimes DEFAULT_EXCLUDE

      • fuzzyDefaultExclude

        public static Rule fuzzyDefaultExclude(List<Rule> rules)
        Return DEFAULT_EXCLUDE, unless first element in rules list is an explicit exclude, in which case return DEFAULT_INCLUDE.
        Parameters:
        rules - rules list
        Returns:
        usually DEFAULT_EXCLUDE, but sometimes DEFAULT_INCLUDE

      • lastMatch

        public static Rule lastMatch(List<Rule> rules,
                             String value,
                             Function<List<Rule>,Rule> selectDefault)
        Evaluate the provided list of rules against the String value using the provided selector function to select the default rule when none match.
        Parameters:
        rules - a list of rules to match against the value. the last one to match, if any, is returned.
        value - the string value to match against.
        selectDefault - a function to select the default rule based on the specified list of rules.
        Returns:
        the last rule in the list that matches the value, or a default rule

      • lastMatch

        public static Rule lastMatch(List<Rule> rules,
                             String value)
        Evaluate the provided list of rules against the String value, using fuzzyDefaultInclude(List) to select the default rule when none match.
        Parameters:
        rules - a list of rules to match against the value. the last one to match, if any, is returned.
        value - the string value to match against.
        Returns:
        the last rule in the list that matches the value, or a default rule
